items.title: to write
items.comment: Common verb used when writing characters or words.

items.title: Chinese characters
items.comment: Refers specifically to Chinese written characters.

items.title: character; word
items.comment: A single written character, often used when asking about writing or reading.

items.title: how
items.comment: Used to ask 'how' something is done.

items.title: to read
items.comment: Refers to reading aloud or recognizing written characters.

items.title: Can you write Chinese characters?
items.comment: Used to ask if someone can write Chinese characters.

items.title: I can write.
items.comment: Simple affirmative response indicating writing ability.

items.title: How do you write this character?
items.comment: Used to ask how to write a specific character.

items.text: 对不起，这个字我会读，不会写。
items.title: Sorry, I can read this character but can't write it.
items.pinyin: duìbuqǐ, zhège zì wǒ huì dú, bú huì xiě.
items.pronounce: dway-boo-chee, juh-guh dzuh waw hway doo, boo hway shyeah.
items.comment: Polite response explaining one can read but not write the character.
